intro: Boottia mossambicensis, commonly known as the Mozambique boottia, is a species of liverwort found in tropical regions. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its small, compact growth habit. The plant typically grows on moist soil or rock surfaces, preferring shaded and humid environments. Its leaves are closely arranged and have a distinct, often serrated margin. Boottia mossambicensis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms.
